intro: Hieracium murorum subsp. jaedrense, commonly known as the rough hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a rough texture. The plant produces yellow flowers in clustered inflorescences, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and is often found in grassy areas and disturbed soils. This subspecies is distinguished by its specific morphological traits and habitat preferences.
